image.altText: Troops stand scattered alone a dirt road.

items.synopsis: The Israeli military says 222 people are being held captive in Gaza, adding that Israeli ground forces also conducted limited raids into Gaza overnight. Follow live.

title.children: Palestinian death toll estimate passes 5,000 as Israel revises number of hostages held by Hamas

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: At least 5,087 Palestinians in Gaza are estimated to have been killed since the war began, according to new figures released by Gaza health officials. Among the dead are 2,055 children, 1,119 women and 217 elderly people, the Hamas-run Gaza health ministry says. Before the latest update, the death toll as stated by Gaza officials stood at 4,651. The ministry also says 15,274 people have been wounded, up from 14,245 yesterday. In Israel, the latest casualty figures show about 1,400 people have been killed — most during Hamas's initial attack on October 7 — and 4,932 have been wounded, the UN has reported, citing Israeli official sources.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Palestinian death toll estimated at more than 5,000: local health authorities

people have been killed — most during Hamas's initial attack on October 7 — and 4,932 have been wounded, the UN has reported, citing Israeli official sources.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A third convoy of aid trucks has entered Gaza through the Rafah crossing from Egypt, Reuters reports. The news agency cited an aid worker and two security sources. The Associated Press also reports that a "small aid shipment" had been allowed in. Here's a map showing the Rafah crossing, the only way into Gaza that is not controlled by Israel. On Saturday, 20 trucks entered Gaza in the first aid shipment into the territory since Israel imposed a complete siege at the start of the war. Israel allowed a second convoy of 15 trucks into Gaza on Sunday .
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: A third convoy of aid trucks crosses into Gaza: Reuters

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Israeli military says it has confirmed that 222 people are being held as captives in Gaza. Chief military spokesperson Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari confirmed the number in a televised briefing. Israeli ground forces also conducted limited raids into Gaza overnight to fight gunmen, Hagari said.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Israel conducts limited ground raids in Gaza, puts hostage number at 222

image.altText: Global tax evasion report 2023

items.synopsis: Australians hold more than one-third of a trillion dollars in known tax havens and profit-shifting by multinational firms deprives Treasury of almost $11 billion a year, finds a new international report.

title.children: The cash to fix the climate crisis and cost-of-living pressures is there if tax evasion is stopped

image.altText: Gordon Bradbery

items.synopsis: Lord Mayor Gordon Bradbery AM says he does not support Hamas or the terrorist activities, but has defended the speech Jewish groups have called "reprehensible and irresponsible" by saying the attack didn't happen in a vacuum.

image.altText: A red R-F-S fire truck in front of burning trees.

image.altText: A close up of a smiling woman.

items.synopsis: A University of Sydney student is among an estimated one million Palestinians displaced by the war in Gaza.

title.children: Asmaa was visiting family when war erupted in Gaza. Now she can't get out

image.altText: Brighton Secondary College Principal Richard Minack has a neutral expression as he stand outside a building

title.children: Imagine cutting Canberra in half and putting the population of Brisbane into it before dropping 6,000 bombs

image.altText: Black and white image of Rock Hudson, he is wearing a dark coloured shirt. He is looking to the right in the picture.
